intro: Notylia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved notylia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and wetlands. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Notylia angustifolia is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
